meanings.definition: The position or office of a trustee.
meanings.sent1: In the school, the trusteeships were held by the teachers who managed the funds.
meanings.sent2: She was honored to be appointed to the trusteeships of the local charity organization.
meanings.sent3: The trusteeships at the animal shelter involved taking care of the furry residents.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to the trusteeships of the museum was akin to being a guardian of history.
meanings.sent5: The trusteeships of the library were crucial for preserving knowledge for future generations.

meanings.definition: The responsibilities or duties of a trustee.
meanings.sent1: Managing the finances was one of the trusteeships assigned to him.
meanings.sent2: She took her trusteeships seriously and always ensured transparency in her actions.
meanings.sent3: The trusteeships of overseeing the community center events made him the go-to person for planning.
meanings.sent4: Balancing the trusteeships of different projects required careful organization and time management.
meanings.sent5: The trusteeships of maintaining the park included keeping it clean and safe for visitors.
